control.name: Responsive text
control.helpHtml: Displays styled text. It resizes with screen-width and moves down if it gets too small.

property.name: Name
property.helpHtml: Name that can be given to the control. Names are used to help identify controls uniquely.

property.name: Form summary label
property.helpHtml: This property is not visible but exists just to allow form integration.

property.name: Label
property.helpHtml: Label to appear above the control

property.name: Text
property.helpHtml: Sets the content of the control.

property.name: Format
property.helpHtml: Enables the text to have a different type of html applied.

property.name: Label for
property.getValuesFunction: // return the list of all controls on the page with the one for this action selected return "<option value=''>Please select...</option>" + getControlOptions(this.control);
property.helpHtml: Label for is used to associate a text element to any other named control on the page. This is especially useful for validation.
